question_text: What risk arises if two DHCP servers are configured on the same subnet without proper coordination?
answer_options: DNS queries will bypass reverse resolution
Clients may receive conflicting or duplicate IP addresses
The subnet mask will be misconfigured on all hosts
Static routes will override DHCP leases
correct_answer: Clients may receive conflicting or duplicate IP addresses
explanation: Uncoordinated DHCP servers can assign the same IP to different clients, leading to address conflicts and connectivity issues.
